result.execSummary:
The defendant Kimberly M Garner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Maintain Drug Trafficking Place, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Any other sentence; Release for inmate work assignments. Court remains silent as to electronic monitoring
May be transferred to another county if accepted and may be terminated after 6 month if approved by agent

miscConds.notes: Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessmend and surcharges, including DNA surcharge, during the course of probation to the probation agent. Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered. Cash bail applied.

- No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statues section 973.176, Court advised defendant of the following restrictions: Firearm possession and Voting

- Maintain Absolute Sobriety. No use or possession/use of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
- DOC's must conduct drug and alcohol testing.
- Court requests probation be assigned to a Mental Health Unit and Mental Health Evaluation and any recommended treatment.
- Court suggests Trauma Informed Mental Health Treatment.
- Court suggests counseling for domestic abuse survivors.
- Fine is set at ZERO.
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kimberly M Garner

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.
AS TO COUNT  1-
Court ordered defendant to serve 60 DAYS  in the House of Correction consecutive to any other sentence; release for inmate work assignments; with credit for 6 days time served. Court remains silent  as to electronic monitoring. 
COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed defendant on probation for 1 YEAR.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:

- Maintain Absolute Sobriety: No use or possession/use of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.  
- Department of Corrections must conduct drug and alcohol testing.
- No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
- No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor.
- Court requests probation be assigned to a Mental Health Unit and Mental Health Evaluation and any recommended treatment. 
- Court suggests Trauma Informed Mental Health Treatment. 
- Court suggests counseling for domestic abuse survivors. 
- Fine is set at ZERO.
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 

Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, during the course of probation to the probation agent. Any cash bail on deposit to apply. Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered. 

- Court notes probation may be transferred to another county if accepted and maybe terminated after 6 months if approved by agent. 

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 

Filed;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Kimberly M Garner in court with attorney Eugene E. Detert.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.

AS TO COUNT 1:

The defendant was advised of her Constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting. Defendant further advised that if she is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

Court vacted jury trial on 09-23-2015. Case proceeded to sentencing.

Exhibits received and inventoried this date.  
Box 656
